result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond P Link was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond P Link is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond P Link was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Raymond P Link in court with attorney Thomas J. McClure.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 3.   Penalty enhancer struck on Ct. 3 by Court upon motion of the State.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed without prejudice.   Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 3:
-  8 days jail - credit for 8 days - Time served        
- Court Costs of $243.00 - apply balance of bail - $143.00 to be paid in 60 days; alternate 3 days jail 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - apply bail    
- Domestic Violence Counseling to be conducted within 9 months - Defense to submit proof of counseling
- No violent contact w/Rhonda L.
